Description: Ensures that each customer_id in tsb.customer_data_bank is unique, validating the integrity of the primary key constraint.
Custom_SQL: SELECT customer_id, COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank GROUP BY customer_id HAVING COUNT(*) > 1

Description: Checks that all records in tsb.customer_data_bank have a non-null customer_id, as required by the NOT NULL constraint for the primary key.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE customer_id IS NULL

Description: Assesses the proportion of records where full_name is missing, helping to monitor completeness of customer identity data.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) AS null_count, (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank) AS total_count FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE full_name IS NULL

Description: Assesses the proportion of records where date_of_birth is missing, critical for age and eligibility calculations.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) AS null_count, (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank) AS total_count FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE date_of_birth IS NULL

Description: Assesses the proportion of records where gender is missing, important for demographic analysis.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) AS null_count, (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank) AS total_count FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE gender IS NULL

Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) AS null_count, (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank) AS total_count FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE address IS NULL

Description: Assesses the proportion of records where phone_number is missing, important for customer communication.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) AS null_count, (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank) AS total_count FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE phone_number IS NULL

Description: Assesses the proportion of records where email_address is missing, important for digital communication and marketing.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) AS null_count, (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank) AS total_count FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE email_address IS NULL

Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) AS null_count, (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank) AS total_count FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE national_id_or_passport_number IS NULL

Description: Assesses the proportion of records where occupation is missing, useful for customer profiling.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) AS null_count, (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank) AS total_count FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE occupation IS NULL

Description: Assesses the proportion of records where customer_type is missing, important for segmentation and product eligibility.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) AS null_count, (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank) AS total_count FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE customer_type IS NULL

Description: Assesses the proportion of records where account_numbers is missing, important for linking customers to accounts.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) AS null_count, (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank) AS total_count FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE account_numbers IS NULL

Description: Assesses the proportion of records where age is missing, important for eligibility and risk assessment.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) AS null_count, (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank) AS total_count FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE age IS NULL

Description: Assesses the proportion of records where created_by is missing, important for audit trail and data lineage.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) AS null_count, (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank) AS total_count FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE created_by IS NULL

Description: Assesses the proportion of records where created_on is missing, important for tracking record creation time.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) AS null_count, (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank) AS total_count FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE created_on IS NULL

Description: Assesses the proportion of records where modified_by is missing, important for audit trail and data lineage.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) AS null_count, (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank) AS total_count FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE modified_by IS NULL

Description: Assesses the proportion of records where modified_on is missing, important for tracking record modification time.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) AS null_count, (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank) AS total_count FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE modified_on IS NULL

Description: Assesses the proportion of records where status is missing, important for operational and reporting purposes.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) AS null_count, (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank) AS total_count FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE status IS NULL

Description: Checks for duplicate email_address values, which should be unique for each customer to avoid communication errors.
Custom_SQL: SELECT email_address, COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE email_address IS NOT NULL GROUP BY email_address HAVING COUNT(*) > 1

Description: Checks for duplicate national_id_or_passport_number values, which should be unique for each customer for regulatory compliance.
Custom_SQL: SELECT national_id_or_passport_number, COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE national_id_or_passport_number IS NOT NULL GROUP BY national_id_or_passport_number HAVING COUNT(*) > 1

Description: Checks for age values outside a reasonable range (e.g., less than 0 or greater than 120), ensuring data validity.
Custom_SQL: SELECT customer_id, age FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE age < 0 OR age > 120

Description: Checks for date_of_birth values that are in the future, which are likely data entry errors.
Custom_SQL: SELECT customer_id, date_of_birth FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE date_of_birth > CURRENT_DATE

Description: Checks that gender values are within expected domain (e.g., Male, Female, Other), ensuring data standardization.
Custom_SQL: SELECT customer_id, gender FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE gender IS NOT NULL AND gender NOT IN ('Male','Female','Other')

Description: Checks that status values are within expected domain (e.g., Active, Inactive, Suspended), ensuring operational consistency.
Custom_SQL: SELECT customer_id, status FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE status IS NOT NULL AND status NOT IN ('Active','Inactive','Suspended')

Description: Checks for invalid email_address formats using a basic pattern, ensuring contactability.
Custom_SQL: SELECT customer_id, email_address FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE email_address IS NOT NULL AND email_address !~* '^[A-Za-z0-9._%+-]+@[A-Za-z0-9.-]+\.[A-Za-z]{2,}$'

Description: Checks for invalid phone_number formats using a basic pattern, ensuring contactability.
Custom_SQL: SELECT customer_id, phone_number FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE phone_number IS NOT NULL AND phone_number !~* '^[0-9+\-() ]{7,20}$'

Description: Checks for records where created_on is after modified_on, which is logically inconsistent.
Custom_SQL: SELECT customer_id, created_on, modified_on FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE created_on IS NOT NULL AND modified_on IS NOT NULL AND created_on > modified_on

Description: Checks for records where age does not match the difference between current date and date_of_birth, flagging inconsistencies.
Custom_SQL: SELECT customer_id, age, date_of_birth FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE age IS NOT NULL AND date_of_birth IS NOT NULL AND age <> EXTRACT(YEAR FROM AGE(CURRENT_DATE, date_of_birth))

Description: Checks for records where account_numbers is present but does not match expected format (e.g., comma-separated digits), ensuring data usability.
Custom_SQL: SELECT customer_id, account_numbers FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE account_numbers IS NOT NULL AND account_numbers !~* '^([0-9]+,)*[0-9]+$'

Description: Checks for records where created_on is not set to the default value (now), which may indicate manual overrides or ETL issues.
Custom_SQL: SELECT customer_id, created_on FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE created_on IS NOT NULL AND created_on::date <> CURRENT_DATE
